Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown ribbed pottery vessel, fabric is black in section, interior covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, exterior covered with a red-brown slip and remains of eleven lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.98)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87604) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87604)
Condition: fair (parts of the interior have flaked away - two pieces joined)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 106 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
